text: The 1990 Montreal Expos season was the 22nd season in franchise history. ==Offseason== *October 26, 1989: Yamil Benitez was signed by the Montreal Expos as an amateur free agent.https://www.baseball- reference.com/b/benitya01.shtml *December 7, 1989: Oil Can Boyd signed as a Free Agent with the Montreal Expos.Oil Can Boyd Statistics Baseball- Reference.com *December 7, 1989: Keith Atherton was signed as a Free Agent with the Montreal Expos.https://www.baseball- reference.com/players/a/atherke01.shtml *January 24, 1990: John Candelaria was released by the Montreal Expos.John Candelaria Statistics Baseball- Reference.com *March 17, 1990: Eric Bullock was signed as a Free Agent with the Montreal Expos.https://www.baseball-reference.com/b/bulloer01.shtml ==Spring training== The Expos held spring training at West Palm Beach Municipal Stadium in West Palm Beach, Florida – a facility they shared with the Atlanta Braves. It was their 14th season at the stadium; they had conducted spring training there from 1969 to 1972 and since 1981. ==Regular season== ===Season standings=== ===Record vs. opponents=== ===Opening Day starters=== *Delino DeShields *Andrés Galarraga *Marquis Grissom *Kevin Gross *Spike Owen *Tim Raines *Nelson Santovenia *Larry Walker *Tim Wallach http://baseball-almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1990&t;=MON ===Notable transactions=== *April 23, 1990: Rex Hudler was traded by the Montreal Expos to the St. Louis Cardinals for John Costello.https://www.baseball- reference.com/h/hudlere01.shtml *June 4, 1990: Shane Andrews, Rondell White, Gabe White, Stan Spencer, Ben Van Ryn and Stan Robertson were drafted by the Expos in the 1st round of the 1990 amateur draft.Baseball Draft: 1st Round of the 1990 June Draft Baseball-Reference.com *June 18, 1990: Rolando Roomes was selected off waivers by the Montreal Expos from the Cincinnati Reds.https://www.baseball-reference.com/players/r/roomero01.shtml *July 2, 1990: Ugueth Urbina was signed by the Montreal Expos as an amateur free agent.https://www.baseball-reference.com/u/urbinug01.shtml *August 8, 1990: Zane Smith was traded by the Montreal Expos to the Pittsburgh Pirates for a player to be named later, Scott Ruskin, and Willie Greene.
